docs.snippet: But a team of legal advisers did not rule out the possibility of graft because it was unable to establish who ultimately received a suspicious payment, a report said....
docs.lead_paragraph: But a team of legal advisers did not rule out the possibility of graft because it was unable to establish who ultimately received a suspicious payment, a report said.
docs.abstract: Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer, concluding its independent investigation, finds no proof of vote-buying in relation to Germany's successful bid to host 2006 World Cup; cautions that corruption can still not be ruled out, given failure to discover fate of suspicious payment that prompted inquiry.

headline.main: Inquiry Into Germany’s 2006 World Cup Bid Finds No Indication of Vote Buying
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Finds No Vote-Buying in ’06 World Cup

docs.snippet: Its first-round matchup against Canada is the first in France’s illustrious but tumultuous Davis Cup history to be played overseas in the Caribbean island of Guadeloupe....
docs.lead_paragraph: Its first-round matchup against Canada is the first in France’s illustrious but tumultuous Davis Cup history to be played overseas in the Caribbean island of Guadeloupe.
docs.abstract: French tennis captain Yannick Noah chooses tropical island of Guadeloupe as location for first-round Davis Cup match against Canada; court construction required French to send 900,000 pounds of clay-court material to stadium and logistics of hosting at overseas department have been formidable.

headline.main: Distant, Tropical Isle Is Home Court for the French in a Davis Cup Match
headline.print_headline: Distant, Tropical Isle Is Home Court for the French in a Davis Cup Match

docs.snippet: The former president was questioned for about three hours in connection with a colossal graft scheme involving the national oil company, Petrobras....
docs.lead_paragraph: The former president was questioned for about three hours in connection with a colossal graft scheme involving the national oil company, Petrobras.
docs.abstract: Brazilian police raid home of former Pres Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and take him into custody in expanding corruption investigation surrounding national oil company Petrobras; detention of da Silva, towering figure associated with nation's economic rise, throws into question both his own and Pres Dilma Rousseff's legacy, as well as Brazil's ambitions.

headline.main: Brazil’s Ex-Leader, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, Is Held and His Home Raided
headline.print_headline: Ex-Leader Held, and His Home Is Raided, as Brazil Graft Scandal Grows

byline.contributor: Débora Nogueira contributed reporting from São Paulo, Brazil, and Mariana Simões from Rio de Janeiro.
